channel.title: Adventures in Tech Land
channel.description: The adventures of a translator around 50 who resumes web "development" after a 20+ years lapse...

item.title: the beginning of a great adventure
item.description: In one of his most recent albums Lou Reed sings about having a child, I seem to remember, but anyway, at one point he sings "it's the beginning of a great adventure", pretty much what I feel today.

item.title: It's all good, man
item.description: I love the Saul Goodman character. He found this name the day he thought about a career change...

item.title: 三日坊主
item.description: We use the expression "三日坊主(ミッカボウズ)" (three day monk) in Japan for people who can't commit to something for more than a few days. Hopefully, my #10000daysof code will be longer than that...

item.title: I am your father!
item.description: I started learning Chinese in January. I thought my "experience" in learning languages would allow me to do it my way. So I bought a few books and asked a student at the local university to help me with the pronunciation.

item.title: Islands
item.description: There is an island, thirty five minutes off the coast by ferry, where I often spend the day. There are only 3 roads and you can walk around it in an hour.

item.title: Just enough wine
item.description: Today I had to attend a party as board member of the local Japan-France association. The wine was nice and the people too. I came home late so did not have much time to work.

item.title: Brother in law
item.description: My brother in law is in Japan for work for 2 weeks so he will stay with us tonight. Back to Tokyo tomorrow evening and back to France on Thursday.

item.title: BBQ
item.description: BBQ on the hill, with all the friends. Twice a year.

item.title: Dreams
item.description: Yesterday I was exhausted. I went to bed at 11:30 and I slept almost until 9. I remember having dreams.

item.title: Awk, my god!
item.description: Yesterday I tried this automation that checked the contents of /css and created an html index from the data. I used unix commands, pipes, redirection, sed, and I managed to have something that worked from the command line, but for some reason (escapes maybe?) I could not make it run from a script.

item.title: Birthday!
item.description: I'm 49 today. I've been telling anyone who asks "I'm close to 50" just to getting used to say the number. 49 is just another step in that direction. Hopefully, 365 days from now, I'll be working on cool web sites that will make the kids proud. I had two cakes today too.

item.title: Math
item.description: I'm writing this on the 23. I could not do much yesterday. Busy with meetings. I did some HS maths though. Trigonometric functions. That was much more fun than when I did them in HS...

item.title: Practice
item.description: Today I had a kendo competition. I have not seriously practiced for close to 2 years. The result was, as I joked on twitter, not "不 (ふ) 動 (どう) 心 (しん) (immovable mind) " but just "不動 ふどう (immovable)".

item.title: 100daysof...
item.description: I started my "100daysofkendo".

item.title: Emacs
item.description: I wrote an emacs lisp script to automate the generation of daily templates.

item.title: CSS magic
item.description: Two days ago I created for the first time a graphic in pure CSS.

item.title: Lots of meta stuff
item.description: I spent a bit part of the evening rewriting the css index generating file. For some reason it refused to work today.

item.title: Slowly
item.description: Progress is slow. But it's what drives my day. I'm waiting for the few hours I have at night to work on freeCodeCamp, to write some code, to read a few articles about such and such web-related technology.

item.title: Very slowly
item.description: I didn't do much at all, but I went to bed relatively early. Around 1am. I still did two lessons on freeCodeCamp. I'm close to finishing the third part in the responsive web certification.

item.title: Stars
item.description: There was an exercise on freeCodeCamp today that was really nice. It was a night sky with stars, and by using animation you had to make the stars twinkle.

item.title: Shakuhachi
item.description: I was at John 海山 カイザン Neptune's free concert in Higashi Ueta today. Higashi Ueta is a bit far from home.

item.title: Emacs again
item.description: Today I worked hard in Emacs. I realized yesterday that my current script was not working for some dates.

item.title: Emacs forever
item.description: I'm not yet done with that function. After realizing my oversight for the December 1st page, it took more time than I thought to fix things.

item.title: Programming is hard
item.description: I've not written in a week, but it's not because I was resting. I was struggling with my emacs lisp code and I'm not done with it yet.

item.title: Stuck between a rock...
item.description: I am stuck where I don't want to be. I want to complete that code and have working templates. But if I pretend it is the most important aspect of my current endeavor then I'll get lost into finicking over "not good enough" when I should be focusing on "good enough".

item.title: A month already
item.description: The beginning is already shrouded in the past. I faintly remember when I started and what I did then, but only reading the daily notices manages to bring back the memories.

item.title: I need a break
item.description: I need a break

item.title: Getting ready...
item.description: I did a lot today. I understand what it means when programmers say "without good comments you can't understand code that you wrote months ago". My code is not complex by any stretch of the imagination, but it took a while to understand again how my emacs lisp templating worked, what was the structure of the project, etc.

item.title: Back to the web!
item.description: Today I updated a Wordpress site I'm in charge of. Simple stuff. The only issue was changing the latitude and longitude data for the Google maps API that for some reason still refused to work.

item.title: Simple HTML
item.description: I'm doing lesson 11 from Basic HTML at FreeCodeCamp.

item.title: RSS feed!
item.description: As I wrote the other day on dev.to, I've been subscribing to a lot of "web design" and various tech feeds recently. And I thought, why not have my own RSS feed for this wonderful hand-typed web-thing that I'm building at the moment?

item.title: Restarting from scratch
item.description:
It's a bit heartbreaking to read previous entries and see how happy I was to start something new again, after so many years. Although there are also things I am happy I did, the last few months were a mess.
So, let me make a list of things I can be relatively proud of and of things I really should reflect on.

item.title: Restarting from scratch
item.description: Learning again, not exactly from where I started, but not exactly from where I left either. A quick brush up of my git workflow, just to make sure it's somewhere I can easily find...

item.title: Where is my template!
item.description: I've been checking the code I wrote last year, found that I did not know how to use it anymore, and decided to check the emacs debugging tools. Now I can step through my code, and evaluate arbitrary expressions while the code is being debugged!

item.title: all those things TODO
item.description: I simply created an org file to keep track of all the things I need to do. The file is also hosted on the site, and I'm going to need to change how the HTML output looks...

item.title: Lots of org-mode
item.description: Modifying my org file for HTML export. All sorts of things to tweak in the manual, pretty cool. But I also need to add a specific CSS for the headings themselves.

item.title: org export
item.description: I spent most of the day working on org-mode export to HTML. My CSS is rusty but I've mostly worked with magit and I'm significantly better at it now.
